permissions.websocket.connect: Allows a user to connect to the websocket instance for a server to stream the console.
permissions.control.console: Allows a user to send commands to the server instance via the console.
permissions.control.start: Allows a user to start the server if it is stopped.
permissions.control.stop: Allows a user to stop a server if it is running.
permissions.control.restart: Allows a user to perform a server restart. This allows them to start the server if it is offline, but not put the server in a completely stopped state.
permissions.user.create: Allows a user to create new subusers for the server.
permissions.user.read: Allows the user to view subusers and their permissions for the server.
permissions.user.update: Allows a user to modify other subusers.
permissions.user.delete: Allows a user to delete a subuser from the server.
permissions.file.create: Allows a user to create additional files and folders via the Panel or direct upload.
permissions.file.read: Allows a user to view the contents of a directory, but not view the contents of or download files.
permissions.file.read-content: Allows a user to view the contents of a given file. This will also allow the user to download files.
permissions.file.update: Allows a user to update the contents of an existing file or directory.
permissions.file.delete: Allows a user to delete files or directories.
permissions.file.archive: Allows a user to archive the contents of a directory as well as decompress existing archives on the system.
permissions.file.sftp: Allows a user to connect to SFTP and manage server files using the other assigned file permissions.
permissions.backup.create: Allows a user to create new backups for this server.
permissions.backup.read: Allows a user to view all backups that exist for this server.
permissions.backup.delete: Allows a user to remove backups from the system.
permissions.backup.download: Allows a user to download a backup for the server. Danger: this allows a user to access all files for the server in the backup.
permissions.backup.restore: Allows a user to restore a backup for the server. Danger: this allows the user to delete all of the server files in the process.
permissions.allocation.read: Allows a user to view all allocations currently assigned to this server. Users with any level of access to this server can always view the primary allocation.
permissions.allocation.create: Allows a user to assign additional allocations to the server.
permissions.allocation.update: Allows a user to change the primary server allocation and attach notes to each allocation.
permissions.allocation.delete: Allows a user to delete an allocation from the server.
permissions.startup.read: Allows a user to view the startup variables for a server.
permissions.startup.update: Allows a user to modify the startup variables for the server.
permissions.startup.docker-image: Allows a user to modify the Docker image used when running the server.
permissions.database.create: Allows a user to create a new database for this server.
permissions.database.read: Allows a user to view the database associated with this server.
permissions.database.update: Allows a user to rotate the password on a database instance. If the user does not have the view_password permission they will not see the updated password.
permissions.database.delete: Allows a user to remove a database instance from this server.
permissions.database.view_password: Allows a user to view the password associated with a database instance for this server.
permissions.schedule.create: Allows a user to create new schedules for this server.
permissions.schedule.read: Allows a user to view schedules and the tasks associated with them for this server.
permissions.schedule.update: Allows a user to update schedules and schedule tasks for this server.
permissions.schedule.delete: Allows a user to delete schedules for this server.
permissions.settings.rename: Allows a user to rename this server.
permissions.settings.reinstall: Allows a user to trigger a reinstall of this server.
permissions.activity.read: Allows a user to view the activity logs for the server.

errors.other_state: An Error Occured in Getting Server Data, Check if the Server has been Suspended or Installing or Getting Transfered to New Node

errors.invalid_password: You have Entered an Invalid Password
errors.backup_not_found: Currently there are no Backups with this Server
errors.schedule_not_found: Currently there are no Schedules configured with this Server
errors.database_not_found: Currently there are no Databases with this Server
errors.subuser_not_found: Currently there are no Subuser with this Server

errors.directory_empty: This directory seems to be empty
errors.no_tasks: Currently there are no Tasks associated with this Schedule

errors.other_user_server: You cannot control Other User's Server

api.value: Get to Account Settings In Panel And Click On API Credentials
api.value2: Then Create an Api Key And Copy the Key and take
